intro: Sulcorebutia luteiflora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered stonecress, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and fleshy, ribbed stems. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which bloom from the axils of the leaves. It is well adapted to dry environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. Sulcorebutia luteiflora is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low maintenance and ornamental value.
